doc.previous: Some examples of polynomial time algorithms  An algorithm is said to be of polynomial time if its running time is upper bounded by a polynomial expression in the size of the input for the algorithm i e T n O nk for some constant k 1 8 Problems for which a deterministic polynomial time algorithm exists belong to the complexity class P which is central in the field of computational complexity theory Cobham s thesis states that polynomial time is a synonym for tractable feasible efficient or fast 9
doc.after: In some contexts especially in optimization one differentiates between strongly polynomial time and weakly polynomial time algorithms These two concepts are only relevant if the inputs to the algorithms consist of integers
